title: Publications
text:
All publications

[2] I. Anokhin, R. Rishav, M. Riemer, S. Chung, I. Rish, and S. E. Kahou, â€œHandling delay in real-time reinforcement learning,â€ arXiv preprint arXiv:2503.23478, 2025.


[3] J. Chmura et al., â€œAIF-GEN: Open-source platform and synthetic dataset suite for reinforcement learning on large language models,â€ in Championing open-source DEvelopment in ML workshop@ ICML25, 


[4] I. Anokhin, R. Rishav, S. Chung, I. Rish, and S. E. Kahou, â€œHandling delay in reinforcement learning caused by parallel computations of neurons,â€ in ICML 2024 workshop: Aligning reinforcement learning experimentalists and theorists, 


[5] S. Chung, I. Anokhin, and D. Krueger, â€œThinker: Learning to plan and act,â€ Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, vol. 36, pp. 22896â€“22933, 2023.


[6] M. Velikanov et al., â€œEmbedded ensembles: Infinite width limit and operating regimes,â€ in International conference on artificial intelligence and statistics, PMLR, 2022, pp. 3138â€“3163.


[7] I. Anokhin, K. Demochkin, T. Khakhulin, G. Sterkin, V. Lempitsky, and D. Korzhenkov, â€œImage generators with conditionally-independent pixel synthesis,â€ in Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF conference on computer vision and pattern recognition, 2021, pp. 14278â€“14287.


[8] I. Anokhin et al., â€œHigh-resolution daytime translation without domain labels,â€ in Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF conference on computer vision and pattern recognition, 2020, pp. 7488â€“7497.


[9] I. Anokhin and D. Yarotsky, â€œLow-loss connection of weight vectors: Distribution-based approaches,â€ in International conference on machine learning, PMLR, 2020, pp. 335â€“344.

title: Hello, world
text:
This is a starter blog post. Quarto supports math like \(Q(s,a)\) and runnable code blocks.


Code
sum(i for i in range(5))


10


Add more posts by running:
quarto create post "my-next-post" --title "My next post"
